The nasty shower is a single unisex shower in the back of the laundry room. The washing machines and dryers are in pieces and do not look as if they work. There was a terrible smell in the air, and it wasn't sewer smell that you'd expect to find occasionally in a campground . I wouldn't want to advise anyone to stay here. Not even my worst enemy.

name: Shannon Davis
text: Also doing business as Hanson's rv park. Stayed here about 6 months. Way to long. The so called owner (Chad) is arrogant and extremely poor at business I don't know how he runs a lawn care and this business because he has no business smarts. The RV Park is Rundown and if you are late on rent he will shut your power off and if you don't pay it he will hook to your camper or whatever you have parked there and repo it. He will not give you anything in writing as to when your rent is due when it is considered late or how much a late fee is. He charges different prices of late fees on different days for different people. He has repoed three different campers while I was staying there and he cut power off to these one day past being late. Legally he is supposed to give you something in writing to let you know what your responsibilities are and what his are. No one will stand up to him or for their rights. He has Semmes Towing come and repo your camper and he won't let you have it back unless you have all kind of paperwork for it and he charges $75 a day that you don't get it knowing that he makes it impossible for you to get it back. The power source there is not sufficient it is not wired correctly everyone that has stayed there it has blown their TVs it blowed my TV my refrigerator and any other major appliance that I had. It is not up to standards and he will not do anything about it. So if you are looking for a place to stay that is not up to standards and you want to be talked to like a dog or like you're ignorant and have your home repoed if you are late on your rent or have your power cut off being late for rent which he didn't tell you when rent is due or how much late fee is. This place should be shut down and it is considerably illegal. One of the gentlemen that was staying there got in a bind and he was late on his rent and he is on disability and he got his camper repossessed and was told to get out within 24 hours and he is now sleeping on the road and the Walmart parking center anywhere he can lay his head because his camper got repoed for being late.

name: Sidney Watkins
text: At first I thought this was going to be a really cool campground to stay in. We were parked in a different way than we were used to and the campground owner really knew how to direct us which was great. We were not hooked up to a sewer system and had to be pumped out. There are chickens and peacocks roaming around and the rooster makes noise pretty much all night long. We were literally right beside a train track which turned out to be okay. Walking over to the creek was a highlight for my son who loves to throw rocks and watch the Ducks swim by. Still say it is very overpriced. Could not get any cell service. And barely any satellite service. The playground is not safe for children to play on. The owner very excitedly told me he made it himself but I could not let my son get on it cuz it did not look safe.

name: Cora Tadeo
text: When we first started planning for our roadtrip, we found out fast that many RV parks have breed restrictions which wouldn’t allow us to stay due to us owning pit bulls which we think is absolutely ridiculous but I’ll save that discussion for another time. Needless to say, we’ve had to get creative in our search for places to stay. I have to admit I was intrigued when I found this place. It has been the most unique place we’ve stayed thus far. It’s a cross between an antique store and an outdoor wonderland...two of our favorite things to do! The owner (Mark) took us on a private tour of his antique collection that he has been working on for years. It was absolutely amazing! He was 100% accepting our furrbabies and considered them as family members. Swimming hole and bike trails onsite looked like a blast but we only stayed for a night so didn’t have much time to explore. Each site has water & electric hookups and there is a sewage drop area onsite as well if needed. There is a Walmart and Alabama Adventure theme park within 15 mins. Perfect place to bring kiddos. Overall we loved this extraordinary place and will be returning!

name: Pamela Saleh
text:
If anything, make sure to stop here, especially if your childhood was an upbringing the east side of the country. Amazing family who owns this place and turned it into something really special! As you enter the best kept secret in America you at first see a small Mom and Pop store. But as you get closer and go to park, your eyes start taking it all in and thats when you realize you found a little piece of heaven here in Alabama. If antiques are your "thang" then this is where ya wanna be. Not just the entire general store inside but the entire outside of the general store as well! And it doesn't stop there. As you walk the large porch attached, your eyes are darting this way and that at all the history of the past that some of us maybe saw in Grandma's kitchen or in Grandpa's garage. As you come out from under the covered porch and the sun hits your eyes, your taken back by what you see next. It's got a small make-shift town right out of the Twilight Zone. Even real people are living in two of the homes so please be respectful of their privacy. Around back of the town is a campground that's perfect size. Not too big, not too small. Just right to get to know your neighbors and have privacy. There's a tire swing, which Rob convinced me to go on, but truthfully I was going to anyway. Haha A playground like we had when we were kids, so make sure you supply the kids with towels for their legs cause it'll be hot, or just do what I did and let them experience real life. Haha
Also, there's a house boat there that adds character to the campground, {make sure you read what's written on it. Haha} Now for the main attraction,....it's a beautiful, peaceful, stream that digs up childhood imagination and feelings of the past for everyone of us. No amount of words or pictures can do justice. This is something ya gotta experience for yourselves. {7000 Prosper Ave. Tell em' Rob and Pamela who came on a rainy day, sent ya!}

name: Joe Nelson
text: It's more a trailer park not a campground. Nothing to do , no internet,no tv reception, no place at your site for a camp fire, no activities , next to train tracks which trains go by at least 3 times a day and in the middle of the night. Only 15 sites. No trees. No place to set up extras like tent .its ok if you are a worker at the strip pit .cause you come home tired from work and all you do is sleep. We would never come back. For 250 dollars a week it's not worth it.

text: So we visited Shark Tooth Creek yesterday. This was definitely a hidden jewel. The family and myself had a great time. Even though it was hot, the gentleman that owns the place was very entertaining with the kids and parents. We’ll visit again in the future.

name: Nonesuch Solo
text:
Always a great time!

Bring a jacket for when you're standing around listening to the history and the instructions. You can leave it in the car when you go down to the creek.  Wear wet shoes or boots, and clothes that can get wet and dirty. Bring a change of clothes and shoes, for yourself as well as your kids, and several warm towels to leave in the car when you return to the hilltop. Bring plastic bags for shark teeth and wet clothes. No concessions, so bring snacks or lunch in the car.

When the children get down to the creek, they will be wading in the creek collecting shark teeth...or if your kid is anything like mine, diving into the creek. They will pick their 10 favorites to take home as a souvenir. T-shirts are also available for purchase.

Mr. Ken is a wonderful storyteller and engages the children at every turn. I've been twice and there was even more magic and mystery this time. This place is such a treasure.

I regret I didn't take many photos at the creek itself, but I had put my phone in my backpack while we were in the water for fear of dropping it.

name: Jennifer Moore
text: Such a cool adventure! We went with our cub scout pack and camped two nights, really clean well maintained grounds. Mr. Ken was awesome and kept us all laughing! He went above and beyond for our kiddos to make sure they had a wonderful experience!!! Our pack found tons of teeth and fossils at the creek, if your looking for a fun educational trip for your group/pack this is a great time!

name: Kristian Eskelund Nielsen
text: We greatly enjoyed our visit with our 3+5 year old and will definitely be back, next time incl. tent for camping! There is a basic toilet/shower setup, firepit and whole lot of calm. Activities besides the obvious sharp teeth excursion includes swimming in the catfish pond + ziplining for the kids (not a steep or fast ride, children up to 10 years of ago may think it is fun).

name: Tyler Hopkins
text: Our family visited Shark Tooth Creek because it popped up on the dark sky map as being a place far away from most light pollution. However, we called ahead and Mr. Ken told us all about the activities that go on during the tour and so we brought our whole family and some friends with little ones. We camped outside in a nice, clean area with immediate access to showers, bathrooms, pavilion, and some deluxe propane cooking grills. He also allowed us to fish his catfish ponds and we caught several 2-4 pounders all day. That evening we enjoyed the night sky in the darkness a New Moon provides, with breathtaking views. The next morning we loaded up, cooked breakfast, and listened to Mr. Ken's presentation before going down to the creek to pick up fossilized shark teeth. On the return to camp, the kids and even parents played and swam before calling it a day. Hope the best of success for Mr. Ken and recommend Shark Tooth Creek to anyone who'll listen until we return ourselves for some more night sky views.

text: I contacted shark tooth Creek a little while ago to schedule a tour. The person I spoke to identified himself as Mr. Ken, who I assume is one of the owners. He proceeded to tell me that August was not a good time to schedule a tour because he didn't have that many people wanting to  tour because of the Heat. Okay? Well, I was attempting to schedule a tour for my family because my son is home from the military. Quite frankly Mr. Ken, sounded belligerent and drunk. When I asked him for a small group tour with my son and his family, he kept babbling (4 or 5 times) he had been doing this for a long time and said he only does tours with large groups of 50 or more and maybe I should choose a date when he has several people coming. He was quite rude. I will not be scheduling a tour. We will be  picking another outing for our son and our grandchildren. We own our own business as well. We know people get tired, but if you do not want business maybe you should change your advertisement on your website, Mr.Ken, to reflect your actual business views! Personally I think this is a poor representation of an Alabama business.

text: Kick Back Ranch is very special to our family. We discovered this beautiful, family oriented Ranch last year. The first time we went, I knew we fell in love. The facility is beautiful and well kept. The owners and all staff were so helpful and kind. My kids love it so much they have their birthday parties at kick back. name: Jerry Myer
text: We had a blast. Slides were fun, pool was clean, the beach was neat and all the little cabins are as cozy as can be. Rent or bring your own golf cart. Cute little store with what  nots, DG and diner close by. There are full time residents there and owners/staff protect their privacy; understand this before you go. If your a respectable natured human being, this will NOT be an issue. Gym on site. Laundry, game room, basketball courts, playgrounds, canoes and paddle boats...all this will keep your kids busy for the weekend. Event center surrounded by cabins  and sidewalks. Looks like a neat venue to have family reunions, weddings or parties. Rv park does lack shade and a little close but the second park (under construction) may have better spacing. Too much to do to stay in the camper anyway. We will be back...our kids did not wanna leave.

name: Amanda Boswell
text: Didn't realize such a great vacation spot was so close to home. Loved our stay and even better, the kids barely picked up their phones all wkend! I can't believe there is anyone crazy enough to leave a poor reviews of this place. Will definitely be going back.

name: Samantha Green
text:
The security guard ruined our entire trip. We had to wear wristbands the entire time. Felt like a prison camp more than a “vacation.” We ended our trip after just one night. We used to go all the time but things have changed. We will never be back and will tell everyone not to go.

We were called on our first night and was told not to drive the golf carts off the gravel for the first half of the day the next day since it rained. Okay, fair enough. So at about 11:45, we drove our cart off the gravel and onto a trail close to one of the first ponds in the place. It was about mid day. The ground was dry. We get our keys taken away while out on the water. We watched the security guard take them. We went to the office to complain and he called us liars saying the owner said the full day.

We had dogs there and where we were staying, there was a fence. We let the dogs out of the car and into the fence, and we got yelled at by the security guard because they were not on a leash. We asked why because they were in a closed fence? His response… ON A LEASH!!!! No explanation. A stray dog came up to us later that day and he came up red in the face screaming at us because she wasn’t on a leash. We explained that it wasn’t our dog and he didn’t care.

This is the most backwards place to stay. It feels more like a prison. Do not go here ever. You couldn’t pay me to stay here. The owners are letting this security guard play Jail House instead of watching for suspicious or dangerous situations. I think his name is Fred. Fred needs to be fired.

name: Johnny Tadlock
text: Kick Back Ranch is a new campground with a nice water slide for kids and adults but unless you are a resident of Kick Back you will not get the best of sites to park on and will not have access to their public pool. They make you wear a colored wrist band while camping which identifies you as a part time camper. Hint don't wear the wrist band and you may be able to get into areas for full timers... Gravel RV spots were in full sun (no shade). We asked if we could get a shady spot when we made the reservations but were told those are for residents of the park. Spots 4-15 are so close together, your common area (normally right side of camper) was right next to your neighbors sewer/septic connection. You smell septic the whole time you are sitting outside. Very bad set-up. I hope they do something about this. Ponds are all over the property (huge property) but they are very dirty and not very fishing friendly. Too much growth around the edges when trying to fish off the bank. You will lose worms, lures, etc.

name: Reginald Fowler
text: I just left a family  Reunion this past weekend at the Ranch and let me tell you I had a blast.The property  is well maintained  and everyone  is friendly  and helpful.  Its only  one thing  that bothers  me is that there is no stocked fish in the lakes. I live in Mobile and I fish alot.  I tried fishing  there and didn't  get one nibble. Other than the unstocked  lakes everything  else  was almost perfect.  Oh and I didn't get a golf cart due to so many rented out. Definitely  will recommend  this place.

name: Lisa Neafus
text:
My husband, I and our service dog lived here for 8 months. In short, a couple moved in wanting our spot. They kept calling the owners on us with untruthful accusations. The wife kept talking to me one morning while I was trying to load my car for work. I asked her to please just leave me alone. She would not stop. I just kept loading my stuff and asked again to leave me alone. The next day I get a call from Mindy, the owner while at work and she let's in on me with several slanderous accusations. She tells me my dog must be removed from the property by that night and if we do not comply, she will call the sheriff. Not once did she ever discuss anything with me prior to this day. I tell you Mindy is the most unprofessional person I have ever met. Talk about accused, charged and found guilty without a trial. We never had words with anyone or were ever warned by the owners. I assure you, the ones who did what we were accused of is still there!!!! My husband did have a civil conversation two days before with the owner's husband and thought they had an understanding. ????I must take this moment to thank Mindy because I did not like her from the first time I met her. We LOVE our new home. We have LOTS of water pressure!!!! I mean my Dawn makes bubbles in the sink!!!! FREE WI-FI!!!!!!! Mindy advertises free wi-fi.  What a joke. We have a foot more room inside our motorcoach. The power was so low there we couldn't get them to slide completely out!! Every time I cooked there I flipped a breaker. We can use all my appliances at one time now!!!! We have grass and a picnic table. Clyde, our service dog, is welcome and has a huge field he can run in. The owners are so kind and welcoming. Our first night here in our new rv park  the owner said they close at six but come on back, he'd be drinking a beer on the front porch and so we joined him!!! The good lord has blessed us with some great friends from Kick Back and I hope we never lose touch. Thank those who loved and accepted us and Clyde. We will never forget your blessings on us.

I failed to mention the owner, Mindy showed up on our lot as soon as my husband got home from work (the same day i received a call at work from Mindy with her accusations)with the park manager and the security  guard carrying an assault rifle!!!!! Really???!  OMG!! We basically kept to ourselves but welcomed anyone that stopped by. We never were even talked to before this day!!!! Just can't wrap my head around such cruel and ridiculous tactics from Mindy.

name: Marylou King
text: The park is not a destination park.  It's good for an overnighter if you are self contained.  There is only unisex bathroom with a toilet, sink, and shower.  All the sites have 50 amp, fortunately, my husband has the proper connectors to go from a 50 amp to a 30 amp.  There is only one pull through spot, which we had and need as we were pulling our car.  It's also near the highway and I was hoping once it got late traffic would stop, but no such luck.  The people in the store that check you in are really nice and the best part is it is on the cusp of Eufaula Wildlife Refuge. The RV campground has fencing around it to protect campers from the alligators that roam.

name: John Ward
text: Nice quiet wonderful place to boat, camp, fish and spend time with family!

name: John Bryan
text: Osprey RV park is a hidden gem. The people are super friendly and the price is right. The location is perfect for fishing, as it is only a minute from the state park ramp. It has plenty of nice sites, all of which are level. It has water and sewer. The only down sides are ants and no concrete pads.

name: David Rose
text: Nice small park, don't worry about reserving your spot. You won't get it anyways. You'll just pick a spot when you get there.

name: Lynette Mosley
text: This is a decent place. I don't know about long term but for passing thru...excellent.And a bonus are the Ospreys and the gators. So cool. The girls who waited on us were real nice and personable. Nice laundry area.

name: Lyssa
text: Stopped for a night passing thru. Was nice, friendly workers.

name: Jamie Smith
text:
We found this Rv Park by luck & my wife and I are so glad we did. When my employer sent me to Eufaula I was less than happy,  because it being a small town I thought the Campgrounds and RV parks were few and limited to amenities. After calling the owner on our drive up I was told the rv Park was open and to “ come on”, I forgot to mention it would be close to 11p.m when we got there but when I arrived I found 3 after hours numbers to call and it was answered on the first ring. I was told to pick any spot I wanted and to come see them the next day. When we found our spot we backed our 40’ fifth wheel in and was happy to see the spots were very level ! The next day after work I went to pay for our week here and met “Joe” the owner of the park , he was so kind and friendly and told us if there was anything we needed to let him know and he would do what he could to make it happen. So after a few days here I noticed the sewer hookup was above our sewer hose and sewer hose supports, after telling Joe within a week his son had came and fixed every sewer hookup at the park! I was originally only staying a week but after meeting Joe and his sons Chris and Wes and feeling so at home I have been here a month, &  hate that we have to leave for another job.
It’s a brand new Rv Park with full hookups and really good WiFi that hasn’t lagged or buffered once! If your traveling through Eufaula Al and need a place to stop this is a great place, and some of the best owners I’ve ever had to deal with! So glad I found this hidden gem!

name: Cathy Lucas
text:
My husband and  I stayed here for 8 days during May and June 2021. Our reservations made well in advance. I have a few complaints.
1. Campsites were so close you could reach out and shake your neighbors hand.
2.  Cable lines had been installed, but someone forgot  to order the boxes.
3.  There was no WIFI really except at the front office.
4. Major renovations were going on during peak season which eliminated  one of the bathrooms and showers.
5. Although pet friendly, there was no dog park or place for our dog to use the bathroom  except for the  empty campsites.
6. For anyone with children,  there was no playground.
7. No pool
I hope with the major renovations ongoing most of my complaints  will be eliminated.
As a positive, the cleaning crew were amazing.

resp.text:
Hi Mrs. Lucas,
I believe you have us confused with another campground.  We don't offer cable or wifi, do not have any renovations going on, don't take reservations, and do have a playground.

name: Tammy Woods
text: They let people rent there monthly, so if you are only able to camp for 3 or 4 days then the likelihood of you getting a space is slim to none..

name: Michelle Sanchez
text: This is a great campground and the owners Dale and Linda could not have been more friendly, and helpful to our group of 8 adult campers. This is mainly an RV camp site but also great for tent campers. It is right on the lake and very quiet. Be sure to say hello to Zeus the Lab and super friendly camp dog and give him some pets and treats. He escorted the ladies to the bath house at night just to keep us safe. We will return to this site preferably when the weather is cooler.

name: Bob Burns

name: ddkeil
text:
So much for Friendly and Inviting. When I called the lady that answered the phone acted like I was interrupting her. She asked what I needed and I told her I was looking to move down there around February and was looking for an RV spot until I could get a place to buy or rent. She said she was not sure if she could make me a reservation or not and then asked how many people and I told her just me and my dog. She immediately asked how big my dog is and told her he is a Min Pin and Corgi cross. She said that was to large of a dog and they only allow small dogs. My dog is well behaved and loved by everyone that meets him and he is a small dog. She said he is too big and that she could not help me.

Not sure if it was really the dog or just the immediate feeling I got of not being wanted there to start with. Either way, I did not get the friendly and inviting feeling from the start of the conversation. Bad part is, I fell in love with the place from the pictures and the reviews talking about how nice and quite it is and the fact that they like to keep rift raft and young noisy partiers out. I like quite and I stick to myself and this place seemed perfect for me, but I guess it was not meant to be.

If you need a quiet place to camp close to all the tourist sights and only a few miles from the beach this is the place to be ! A diamond tucked away from it all yet close too. The best of both worlds .... Will definitely recommend !!

text: Just hung up phone with them. The have photos of play area and fishing but only allow 2 adults and small dog. No children allowed. She said they are a "liability hazard".

name: first last
text:
This is hard because the place is great. Large well kept lots, good rates, nice big inexpensive laundry room, good wifi, NO highway noise, good location, beautiful lake which is likely why they don’t want small children staying, do you want your child to drown? No.
But that concrete plant starts at 5:30am, one day they started at 3:30am! 7am on Saturday. I have a new respect for concrete workers.
When my husband made the reservation, they did tell him about the plant and said he could select better WiFi or less noise. He selected better WiFi. The noise didn’t bother my husband but he could probably sleep in the middle of the Super Bowl.

name: kitt katti
text: This actually is a very cute little campground. The sites are large enough to accommodate any size rig.  There is a cute little lake and every site has a view. The wi-fi is awesome. The reason I gave it two stars is the NOISE.  Yes, it is off the beaten path and close to everything, but it is next to a CONCRETE PLANT that starts at 5:30 in the morning, seven days a week.  The owners are very nice, but I think they could have told us when we made the reservation for a month with no refund that this might be an issue.  Instead when I checked in, she mentioned it.  We are taking a loss and moving elsewhere.

name: Jerry Watson
text: Stayed there for the last several October's, and plan to stay many more, another park said my RV was to old, doesn't matter I have spent  over hundred thousand on up grades, I love this place, I'm older so the concrete plant working at 6 am, while I have my coffee reminds me I'm on vacation. I feel safe and welcome here.

name: Carl Nethery
text:
The owners were very nice, but that is all I can say nice about the RV Park
Most of the spaces are sand & gravel & alot of Fire Ants ( so beware). The only thing to do there is to fish.  But if you wanted peace & quiet this is NOT for you as there is a Cement Factory beside the Park.  It starts operation at 5:30 in the morning & goes all day.  The only day they do not work is Sunday. (Yeh peace & quiet for one day).
To bad because if a small park & fishing is for you this would be perfect.  If you like to get up at 5:30 & will be gone all day I guess this would be for you.
Also you would think the price would be lower than the other nicer RV parks but it is not.   It was NOT a very nice experience.   I will read reviews from now on.

name: cory roberson
text:
Our names are Cory and Angel. Angel will be reviewing because she spends the most time at the campgrounds.
I have been waiting to start reviewing some campgrounds we have stayed in. I was waiting so I would have a few to compare against. We have now stayed in 12(some more than once) since June 2019.
First about us, my fiancé is a pipe welder and we live in our RV full time traveling from job to job. We moved into the RV fulltime in June 2019.
We are currently in this campground and will be leaving Friday May 1st,2020. Moved camper here to work at GP plant that's less than 2 miles away. And just found out we need to move to Chickasaw for another job.
Laundry is nice. Campground was just sold so we didn't meet the new owners. Previous owner is very sweet. I'm not sure what the new owners will do but currently there is no one here to pay. She runs a place of business a few miles down the road and comes in the afternoon to get payment after you setup. Park is very clean. Had some issues with ants but its been raining a lot so that's understandable. The line of sites where we got on aren't really level but we picked it because its closest to the woods and away from most campers. We would certainly return here.
Weekly rates are $156 with tax.
Our stay was April 24th - May 1st, 2020

name: Howard Randall
text: Great RV camp.

name: Bridget Williams

text: What can I say about this park that's different from the others .I have yet to be at a RV park in the south .Every one I have been to the staff is friendly and ready to help you how ever they can .great amanaties including bathhouse and on site laundry .

text: Nice basic Campground.  Occasionally there is a bad smell coming from the near by sewage treatment plant.

resp.text: Thank you for staying with us. The odor was from the paper mill. Mostly the wind comes out of the west, but unfortunately we get some odor when the wind comes out of the South and the humidity is high.  We hope to see you again.

name: Cheryl Sullivan
text: We stayed almost a year. It Hadden been opened very long when we first got here. The new owners are great, very friendly and keep the park clean. Every spot has a grassy spot. Plenty  of room in between rvs. Very quit n friendly place. It feels like home away from home. We've made plenty of friends around the rv park. There is always someone walking or walking there dog. My 2 year old rode her little jeep or tri cycle around the park. We also rode our golf cart. You feel safe and around family here..There is everything you need just mins away from grocery stores, shopping all kinds of activites.  Great places to eat out. A must is davids catfish house..There is a bunch of little towns around to explore. I would recommend this place to anyone.

name: Jeff Cornelius
text: Nice intimate, quiet camp, stayed over the winter and will stay again. Good facilities, great proximity to shopping, dining and activities. Owner and caretaker showed the meaning of Southern hospitality.

name: Zachary Nowell
text: Quaint Rv park me and my wife and our 3 dogs stayed here for the weekend was quiet and nice hope to come back soon when visiting family. The spots are rock and are hard so no sinking in the host is very friendly and nice and goes out of his way to make sure you are comfortable through your stay! His name is Tom. Very nicely shaded as well to help the rv stay cool in that summer weather and far enough away from the highway you dont get that traffic noise.

name: John Baker

name: Chauncey Hart
text:
I have been camping for years, and i have been to many camp grounds, but this one really set it's self above everyone. As soon as I got there The owners made me feel very welcome. Gregg made sure I had a really good spot to set up my tent. After I got all settled in, I walked up the club house and was introduced to some of the other campers. No one was rude, or made me feel like i was a outsider. Everyone at the camp group visitor and owners alike made me feel like for the first time in my life I could be myself and have fun.
The weather was wonderful as well, even though the first day was rainy it was still very pleasant and the rain helped you sleep well. The sun  and the breezes made beginning and the pool just the place to go. If you didn't want to be by the pool you could sit ob the deck  and just chill out. I opted for beginning pool side and had a great time even though i got myself sun burned. NO amount of spf can help if you sit out in the sun to long. The pool its self was great. I had never been in  salt water pool and I loved it. It was just cool enough to help against the heat but warm enough to enjoy it  anytime day or night.
The location was awesome, i need to get some things from the little of Columbia  AL near buy and it was very nice . The people and shop owners were all very  friendly.  They told me about different things in the area and where honestly nice. I couldn't find a fake smile from a single one. I even heard a couple of good jokes from one of the ladies from the gas station i visited . It isn't far from the Florida state line and only a couple of hours from Panama city and the beach which was great fun even in the off time i was there. I got a couple of eye sore shirts and enjoyed the beach to some degree.
But there was a couple of a draw backs to my time there. One my cell phone didn't really work at the camp site (Thanks t-mobile I will be dropping you as soon as I can!). The supervisor cats really didn't seem to like dog guest  the much. (even thought I loved petting every one of them.)
But over all I loved this camp ground and i am working on my next trip to go down as soon as i can.

text: Zero amenities, price seemed exorbitant for the region, but they were the only place available when we evacuated due to the hurricane. Woman explained the rate was now higher than the website, not sure if they were price gouging due to the influx of Irma evacuees or not. Neighbors were nice, had obviously been living here for quite some time... This is more of a long term trailer park than an RV resort.

name: Allison Fletcher
text: I have absolutely loved staying here! I have been here for 8 months while attending grad school at the sea lab, and I’ve never had any issues. It’s a nice clean place to stay and the manager, Peggy, is amazing! She is so helpful, welcoming and really cares about the tenants and the park. We have become great friends and she really looks after me. Everyone that works there is friendly and helpful. Summer time is the best time to stay because the pool is beautiful, and management will cookout and make food for everyone. The owner will also make food for the park once a month! I have had some amazing neighbors as well and made new friends. It’s in a great location as well because it’s 15 min to Mobile and 25 min to Dauphin Island. It’s also 4 miles from the beautiful Bellingrath Gardens. Check it out! I highly recommend!

text: Stopped in on our way back from traveling, wanted to visit the Uss Alabama and Bellingrath Gardens. Came in late in the evening, manager was pretty friendly. The sight had a covering, but $50.00 a night was way too expensive for this campground. The pictures on the website were very misleading, the site said free cable, called the office to find out where was the hookup, surprise no cable. The grounds were kind of sketchy, couldn’t wait to leave from there.

name: Chrysa Meyer
text: My husband and I moved out of the park about a year and a half ago, and we were there about 8 months. The only reason we went there was we had a fema camper and no one else accepts them. The owner tried to have us pay $50 extra a month to even keep our small yorkiepoo! Cable is only available if you have a mediacom box but they never stated that when we moved in. My husband had to beg for the WiFi password they advertise as free with moving in, even when we got the password  we only had a small WiFi signal half of the day while the landlord lives it up on the same WiFi. (We believe he changed password that day and never had it again.) The pond they have is full of poo and little life. Neighbors knocked on our door asking for food, money, rides etc. on the regular. Not a safe or happy place at all.  One of the biggest things I disliked about this place is it is a FLOOD PLAIN! That was a huge deal for me using a wheelchair unable to see the light of day for days at a time because the water was too high for my $36,000 powered chair. Oh and when you move in they trick you into letting them keep your security deposit, read the contract and don’t sign until they take away that one condition. All in all this is the worst place in comparison to other RV parks. Don’t pay for a patch of grass and bad neighbors that’s all you’ll ever get for $410 here. Someone report them please.

name: kimberly boyer
text:
1st just let me say.  The photos on Google are wrong. The picture of the industrial building is wrong and I never saw any rats. That is NOT of the bellingrath rv park. The pictures I posted are the real deal.
Also this is a RV PARK. Not a resort or a campground. It is a nice place,  the people who live here are down to earth people.  They are friendly and the staff is helpful.  The owner Mr Dupre and his office manager Peggy were very good to us .  Chris and Bill who work at the park along with a few others.  Worked very hard moving rental campers around to make room for the influx of hurricane Irma evacuees . They also keep the park nice and clean. They have a very nice clean pool which my daughter and I took advantage of.  She's also played with all the children that were here. Needless to say she had a good time playing on the playground and with the other children. Laundry and bath house are clean. About 8 Dollars to wash 3 loads of clothes and dry them. Not bad.  Once again this is a RV park not a resort. People live here. They do have trailers to rent they are dateded.  They have full hookup cable lots of channels. Lots. Disney jr. Football anything you might want to watch.  They are making improvements. Covered concrete slab to park your fifth wheel or diesel pusher. Bus. Or camper. All in all this place was a great place to stay. People are friendly and helpful. My husband, daughter and I will stay here again if we are ever in the area. Also. This RV park is in the middle of everything . The uss Alabama is not far and dauphin park is close also the gulf coast. So listen people if you need a place to stay in a nice clean quiet place to stay for an night, week, month or year check this place out.  Lots of Bang for you buck.

name: Sam Mulcahey
text: Great place. Family friendly. Very clean pool and playground area. Covered paved campsites to park camper. Can accomadate busses and larger rvs. Quiet very clean .  Has laundrymat and bath houses . cable wifi and all the goodies. No loud music ever heard. Has rentals on site.   Dont understand all the bad reviews. Well staffed and willing to help if you have issues.

name: Jessica Haury
text: Stay clear of this place!!! When you first go in the woman at the desk named jill will try to act really nice and friendly, but she is really not!!! We stayed there for a few days and we got such a weird feeling staying there that we decided to leave and we had already paid them up for a month. We went and told them we wanted to leave that we need our money back and she kept saying she would have to talk to the owner to come back the next day so we did and she kept saying she couldnt get ahold of him and she doesnt have the key to the safe. So she told us to come back the next morning and still she couldnt get ahold of the owner then she ended up getting ahold of him and she started telling my husband that they could give us our money back and that my husband had agreed on $350 and my husband said no i never agreed to that she said yes you did i have it on camera where you did my husband said well roll the tapes back then i wanna see it and of course she didnt do it ! Anyways somehow she still couldnt get the money because the owner couldnt come again to meet us til like the next week i think it was and my husband explained to her that we cant do that that we needed our money back so we could get back home that was a 10 hr drive and that we had no place to go and she said i will go ahead and let you stay a week for free i know the manager will get mad but im gonna do it! Well the manager ended up comin by our camper on a four wheeler and told us to be up there a little bit before the week was over and we would work something out and my husband said ok. Well we went to the office and still he wasnt there to meet us the woman called him texted him... He still wouldnt come to the office to meet so we could talk to him and finally told the woman to get the money out of the safe, but all she gave us was like $300 and said she would send us $50 in the mail and my husband and i told her no that isnt right you owe us like $580 then she said well he says thats what he owes u my husband said no it is more than that we figured it all up on a calculator right in front of her and she said ill tell u what i will give u the $300 now then send you the rest in the mail even if he dissagrees i will get it out of the safe myself and send it to you so we went ahead and agreed cause we were tired of arguing knowing that we are more than likely going to get ripped off but we were so ready to get home that we just did it. Anyways we get home and call her at the time she told us to and of course jill told us oh i wont be able to give u the $50( she owed us like $280 not $50) because we didnt clean the camper before we left which we did she said that is a $40 fee and we had forgot to give them the key before we left so that was a $10 fee and might i add she was laughing as she told my husband this! So my husband told her she would be hearing from our lawyer and hung up the phone. Oh and one more thing i want to add the second time my husband went to the office to try to get the money back he went by hiself and she went off on him when he asked about the money started hollering and screaming at him my husband said mam i am not raising my voice or nothing i am talking ti you calmly and you are being very rude i just want my money back! My husband ended up just walking out and came back to the camper where i was. And the woman acts like she is under the influence of some kind of speed she talks jerks around really fast! Just take this as a warning do not go here! We never got all of our money back we could take them to court, but would cost more money in the long run since we live 10 hrs away!

name: KJ Aubrey
text:
The owner was friendly over the phone at first, but I feel that she could have been more up front about the nature of her place. That would have saved us a wasted 23 mile trip both ways. Waterloo is a beautiful place, but I would rather stay on the free TVA land than at this so-called campground. The campground is actually a trailer park with some spots for camping. We stay in many campgrounds, some better than others, but this is the first time we have driven through a campground and left. I could not even find the camp office to begin with and everybody at the trailer park was staring us down when we drove through.

When I couldn't find the office, I called the owner back to tell her we had changed our minds. She did not answer her phone. I got a phone call later on from a different number and it was the owner. I let her know that her park was not what we expected and that we had changed our minds. She got an attitude with me and said, "Thanks for letting me know. I waited for you for over an hour." I then informed her that I had tried to call and she didn't answer. I did not bother to mention that she wasted an hour of my time and the gas that I used to drive to her disappointment of a trailer park that she is trying to pass off as a campground. If you do decide to camp in Waterloo, I would suggest that you turn right on the road before you cross the bridge into town and stay on the TVA land. It is well maintained, peaceful and it is free.

resp.text: I am sorry that our campground was not what you expected. Our property is 2 businesses, a small campground on the water with bathhouse, boat launch, fishing dock. The main portion are Lake lots that we lease yearly for vacation sites. It's not unusual for people to turn in the wrong drive; I keep meaning to get new signs but since my husband died in March I've been trying to juggle the whole thing alone. After we spoke, I did see that you had called the office number, which is supposed to be transferred to my cell phone. So I called you at 6:10 and we both missed each other. I apologize for my shortness, I have no excuse for that except that 14 hour days, 7 days a week sometimes gets me overwhelmed.   I'm usually pretty nice.  Our campground is usually not full in the fall, and the weather is perfect for camping. If you ever decide to reconsider camping with electric, water , and hot showers, I would be glad to make up to you your "wasted 23 mile round trip". Thank you for your review.

text: Great place for sunsets and sunrise over the TN river. And eagle watching !

name: Mary Morrison
text: Been going to this campground for 13 years....it is like family and going home. We camp at many different campgrounds from private to state parks and they all offer different amenities.  At Hart it is shaded, beautiful views of the water, hot showers and friendly people...the owner treats everyone like family...we love Harts

resp.text: You are family! Thank you!

name: RV Mobile Repair, LLC
text: A beautiful place to camp along the Tennessee River. Everyone seems really friendly there.  If you're there and you need some RV work call662 me306 at0937

resp.text: Thank You!

name: Lee Hemming
text: We were greeted by the very helpful and friendly owner. The views are beautiful, however with the description and great reviews, we expected a little more. This is more like a rustic fishing camp. It was recommended that we not use the coffee maker and the microwave at the same time. Yikes! 30 amp service is old. Picnic tables need help. Grass sites. Also there was a dog roaming in the park that was unfriendly, so we didn't feel comfortable having ours out and about. Paid $17 for the night, a fair price, probably. With a few upgrades, this could really be a hidden gem. Grocery and dining not close, so bring what you need.

resp.text: Thank you for staying with us, Mr. Hemming. Your review is pretty accurate, upgrading our electric and some cosmetic work on the tables etc have been in our plans. We actually met with the Utility Company last year , and are still waiting on their approval of the plans . The campground sites were built in the 1970's, and RV requirements have definitely changed since then. We do have some 50amp service, I'm sorry I did not show you those sites. I hope we will be able to get to work on that soon, and that when we do, you will come see us if you ever swing south again!

name: mkw Watson
text:
Well the race was a good one the way the newly designed infield was run was not good in any way.
The tram system was a sham system.
They have no clue how to move people from there very expensive infield sties to the stands.  Very poorly done.  We also spoke to a person who identified herself as a nascar employee of a high rank.  No reply from her either.
Infield is just what they say it is.  Drunk fest. And we did enjoy the company and festivities.  We paid extra for garage experience and it was worth it.  But the food and drinks in the stands could only be described as a rip off to the extreme, and the fact that you had to walk miles to get in was a disgrace.
Once locked in the infield you are held captive to the 10 dollar golf cart ride and no way to walk out.   No bridge. No tunnel. No way to get out without paying.  Until Friday afternoon. When you can walk to get a tram that takes you to a very non convenient location.

Good job to tallidaga. ( sarcasm)

Oh and there is no way to send a message to them.   Cause they don’t care really.  :)
And neither dose nascar clearly. ( vice of finance)

Should have thought it through a tiny bit. If you build it people will come.  Until they realize how poorly it’s run.

Thanks.

text: I use the boat ramp here for kayaking. $5 launch fee. Beautiful area ideal for fishing and wildlife viewing. Well worth the 5er every time.

name: The Jacksonville Baby Company
text: Great little hidden gem! We were greeted by a sweet elder upon check in. She was thorough and helpful. The bathhouse was kept up with and clean. The campsite was amazing! My only complaint was the lightpole is on all night. Lake views from every site. We would bring our kayaks next time. We never found the dumpsters so we ended up taking trash home with us. Admittedly we didn't ask look hard, but did drive the campground and never saw them. That's a good thing and a bad thing, lol.

name: Sophia
text: Campground is right beside a paper mill that operates 24/7. Very loud crashing and machinery running ALL night. The campground itself was nice, tidy bathrooms and large sites and friendly camp host. We were tent camping and the noise/smell from the paper mill really put a damper on the trip. If you’re in a camper maybe you can drown out some of the noise.

name: Cricket Perkins
text: We had fun. The bathrooms, showers and laundry rooms were all clean. We got to see gators. The sites are hit or miss on size and privacy. Our site was huge but there was a site super close to the back of us.  It didn't affect us since we were the only campers in our loop. We had water side but didn't really have good access to the water to put kayaks in but several other sites did. Bring mosquito spray! We wouldn't mind staying there again though.

name: David Struble
text: The good ole days of pulling up to the gate and paying to camp are over !! Now you have to contact recreaction.gov by phone or online to make reservations. If you make reservations and for some odd reason need to cancel let me warn you now ! I made reservations at 3 pm, found out at 3:50pm I had to work. I called at 4:20 pm to cancel. They ( recreaction.gov) told me a $10 charge will apply for not canceling within 60 minutes of my reservations.. So I said ok may I bump my camping trip for the following weekend ? I was told it would be $10 to move it to the next weekend !!! I'm sorry but $10 is $10 unnecessary dollars... the lady was rude and blamed the fee on bluff creek.. if I didnt like the Camp Ground host so much I would never stay here again. So be warned on cancellations. And one last thing- I was told to cancel it would take 14 days to get my refund less the 10 damn dollars !!!

name: Richard Mercier
text:
We only stayed here for 2 nights but we loved the campgrounds.
Everything is clean bathrooms included. The campsites are large and have big pads and table and room enough for big trailers.
We were right at the waters edge a very nice place to be.
There were also deer walking through the campground.
While in the area we went to Providence Canyon in Lumpkin GA.
The Canyon isn't far from Bluff Creek and is worth the ride bring your camera and walking shoes.
We will make planes to get back here soon.

name: Deborah White
text:
My famiy and I camp here at least 4 weeks during the summer. The staff are friendly, but abide by the rules. There is plenty of parking for visitors to your camp site. Each site allows you to have your canopy (for RV/Camper) open at all times. It also has a large pad with a picnic table, grill, and fire pit. The bathroom facilities are SUPER clean! In the womens restroom there are benches near the showers and two sinks (1 regular/1handicap). You have your choice of three bath facilities throughout the grounds. There is tons of nature all around. My husband takes his boat and spends the day fishing. There is a fish cleaning house when he returns. They have laundry facilities too.
Oure kids are able to ride their bikes without me worrying of them leaving the grounds. Its a nice place to relax and enjoy family time.

name: Bryant Betsill
text:
A Near Perfect little COE park on the Chattahoochee River in Alabama. Just 30 minutes south of Columbus, GA or Phenix, City (I didn't spell it wrong) Alabama Bluff Creek this weekend was very quiet. There were maybe 12 camp sites occupied of 83 available. Camp host and campers all said it was unusual for the second weekend after Memorial Day Weekend. If you use the COE website for reservations know that the camp map says sites have no access to the water / lake. Even if the map shows campsites up next to the water, understand that the campsite overlooks the lake and inlets, but from 6 to 8 feet directly above the campsite. For many campsites, you can see the water, but would have to have a rope ladder to access the water.
This is one of the smaller COE parks we know of on the Chattahoochee River. The property is well kept as are the bathhouses with laundry. This campground is very fisherman friendly with a screened in fish cleaning station and cleaning tables at every site. Most of the sites are separated by 30 feet of dense brush. Most sites are deeply shaded. (Ours was so shaded we needed the interior lights in the trailer at high noon.) Most sites are easy to back into. Only those along the Bluff Creek side have direct access to the water. There is only one thing that is a drawback, and that is the pulpwood mill adjacent to the park on the Mill Creek side. When we go back, and we will go back, we will camp on the Bluff Creek side and put a little more room between us and the pulp mill.

text: We love this place! We had an awesome lot on the lake that was perfect for weekend getaways. Awesome manager and owner - they are super friendly, easy to work with and wonderful with communication. I can see where parking would be a little tight at when all residents are visiting their campers/places on the lake but it wouldn't be much of a problem as there's overflow parking. Playground for the kids and fishing docks, a volleyball net and basketball hoop. Always clean! We didn't get to experience the game room nor showers as we had our lot during Covid. I'm sure it wouldn't disappoint though! I would recommend this to anyone looking for long term.

resp.text: Wow!  I don't know what you were expecting, but we make no pretensions of being a fancy (or expensive) RV Resort.  We're proud to be an economical, family-oriented campground on a beautiful lake.  Most of our campers leave their RVs here year-round and come up on weekends and vacations.  Some of our campers have been here over ten years.  We leave a few spots open for short-term guests who want to relax on the lake, but if that wasn't for you, we completely understand.  By the way, all of the photos on our website are completely accurate.  My wife took them all!

name: Robert Dardenne
text:
Stayed at Grandstand RV just to be sure I want to stay here, for a week, for the fall Talladega race.  Well I’m sure and already have reservations.
This is a very nice campground.  Lots are spacious pull through, some with hard packed gravel, fire pit and pic-nick table on concrete pad. Bath house almost complete and sewer hookup in the works. Currently there is a dump station.   Kids play area, fenced doggie play yard and pavilion with pic-nick tables.
The owners live at the park and could not have been nicer.
I guess it’s called Grandstand RV, because if it were any closer to the track, it would be in the track parking lot.

resp.text:
We are so happy you choose our park for  race week and even happier you came over for the weekend to check things out and enjoyed yourselves and the park! Thank you for the really great review! You are so appreciated!
See you in a couple months!!! 🙂

name: Amanda Cross
text: We came in after dark in the pouring rain without a reservation. I called, they answered and we were on a nice level gravel covered site within minutes. The friendly and accommodating owners live on site and have created a very comfortable place for us and our dogs. We will be returning here whenever we are in the area.

resp.text: Thank you so much for staying with us and for this great review! We really enjoyed talking with you and hearing about what you guys are doing while in town. We look forward to having you and your family back!

name: Miss Dee
text: Stayed for the April Talladega race week in a spacious pull through site.  Facilities (dog park, community fire ring, pavilion, playground etc) were nice.  Park is very clean and well maintained.  The family that owns and operates this park provide EXCELLENT customer service.  We will be back in 2022.

resp.text: Thank you so much!!! We are so happy you enjoyed your stay and very excited to have you back in 2022! 🏁 Have a great year!

name: whitney white
text: We spent the weekend for the Talladega Nascar spring race. The team at Grandstrand were awesome. They went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. Always available for any issues and go out of their way to say hello or check on ya. The sites and grounds are well very well kept. There are pull thru gravel sites along with grass sites. All I believe had water and electric hookups. There was a dump station and during race weekend they had mobile dump pump trucks available for a fee. They also had porta john's set up around the grounds or you could rent your own if needed. The dog park and camp store are very nice and convenient. The ground are directly next to the speedway for easy walking access but off the main highway for camping privacy. We definitely plan on returning in the future. Appreciate the stay and hope to see you soon !!! 👍👍👍 Keep me posted on the cabins for the future 👍👍👍

resp.text: Thank you so much for staying with us and for the great review! We appreciate this kind words so much!! Cabin #1 is in the process of being built now 🎊 Can’t wait to have you guys and all the pups back at the park! 🙂 Have a great summer!

name: Joe Bagadonuts
text: Closest private campground to Talladega Superspeedway. Electric, water, free site dump, and dump station on campground. Plus free ice.  Big level sites.

name: Jason Marsh
text:
We have been camping at GrandStand RV Park since 2016 for Talladega Spring Race. When new owners purchased it last year, we were worried that new changes would make us look for a new location. However, after meeting with the owners and seeing the improvements that were made, we plan on staying there every year we come to Talladega.
The owners are outstanding people and care alot about their customers.  They actually took advice from regulars about making slight changes. They are always open to ideas.

If you needing a place to stay for a night or just want to get away for a couple of days, I would highly recommend this rv park. 2 of the owners are also military veterans which is another reason to stay there. They love there military veterans.

resp.text: Thank you so much for staying with us and for this awesome review. We absolutely loved having you guys here, hanging out and talking with you. We very much appreciate all your advice! Thanks again and we hope to have you guys back again soon.

name: Casey Reho
text: This park is phenomenal! Clean, affordable, easy to maneuver in and out. So close to the race and the new owners are fantastic! They are willing to help with anything you need and are so knowledgeable about RV-Ing which is great for a novice like me! I can’t wait to see all the new upgrades that are being made. A+ Grandstand, I will definitely be returning.

resp.text: Thank you for staying with us and your kind words! We loved having you here and look forward to your return! Safe travels!!

name: Doug Bevier
text: Needs restrooms. Costly for not having any amenities. Good place for a short stay over.

name: Marta Logan
text:
If your here for fishing and plan on being up early thank Pecan Grove is just fine. But we had a concerning arrival. We did arrive late as we told the lady who took our reservation a 2 weeks prior and the website stayed open until 9 pm. We arrived at 8:45 pm. She answered the phone saying she didn’t have our reservation and that we must have made it somewhere else. But a after giving her multiple details she decided to get dressed and help us find a spot.
We were here on vacation and only spent two nights actually at camp sit the r eat out on neater on boat. Both mornings to be woken up by either a hammer or lawn mower before 7 am. It would have been night to sleep in on vacation.
So if your coming to fish and leaving early it’s perfect, small place and close to water.

resp.text: We sincerely apologize for the headache all of this caused you during your stay. I agree being woken up early on your vacation is not fun. I am thankful you brought this to our attention and have adjusted our labor working hours to better suit our vacationers. As far as the problem you ran into upon arrival we are currently making changes to management operations so we hope to have resolved anything from happening in the future. We hope to see you again in the future.

name: CJ Kay
text: We actually stayed here for a few months a while back. It would be a MUCH nicer place if the guy that runs it wasn't a complete jackass ! Other than that, the neighbors are friendly & it's very peaceful most of time. Oh, if he asks you to pay cash.. MAKE sure he doesn't pocket the money. He has pulled that with a few people the few months we stayed.

resp.text: We apologize you had anything less than pleasant experience while staying with us. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and are currently making changes to our management operations. We are in the process of getting the "Square" system as another option of payment for our tenants and vacationers. We hope you come back and see us.

name: Kris Jensen
text: This is a small RV park with many trees. The staff are friendly and the Wifi is good. Place is a bit rundown. No bathrooms, and the laundry is sub par: one washer and dryer in a shack. The road noise is quite bad. We stayed two nights in a 35 foot fifth wheel.

name: Ron Turner
text: Terrible experience, the owners of this park have entrusted two of their residents to manage the campgrounds. I had a poorly worded threatening note duct taped to my door by “management” during my stay. The less tenants, the happier these folks are. By far the absolute worst experience I have ever had at a campground and I spend probably 80% of the year traveling from camp to camp.

resp.text: I am so sorry it has taken this long to see this and apologize for the terrible experience you had while staying with us. I want to ensure you that we have very recently made changes to our management operations to better make our tenants stay more pleasant. I hope you will give us another opportunity in the future to make your stay a more pleasant one.

name: Michael Bowman

name: FlipMo82
text: Absolutely wonderful. Great place to camp. We had had a rough day trying to find a place to camp. We traveled 3hrs with no luck. The Lads campground popped up on google maps so we gave them a call at 6pm. When we thought all hopes of finding a camp spot was lost, these fine people welcomed us with open arms last minute. Great rates and very quiet place to stay.  We will be back. 5 stars...

name: Raymond Dunlap
text: Seems like a nice Campground everybody was quiet that evening and we were worn out but the driveway needs work badly really rough

name: kelly samples
text: Loved it here. Great, quiet, country place right on the water. The owner was super friendly and accommodating. Everyone is friendly here. Beautiful grassy lawns for the kids to play in. Definitely going back.

name: Christian Harris
text: Very friendly! Bathrooms arent the cleanest, and the only store within a 30 minute drive is a Piggly Wiggly. Schoolie friendly, beautiful view, and a cheap overnight stay.

name: Melissa Fitts
text: Absolutely love this campground.the owner Di Wade is very kind and helpful. The other campers were awesome . Really enjoyed our stay. Will definitely be coming back.

name: Gary Early
text:
Great place to get off to for the weekend or year or two, what ever you need to do,I LOVE IT! !

THANKS, GARY

name: Amanda Cantrell
text: The camping sites were great and the bathrooms and showers were very clean. The lovely family that runs the camp made our stay better than we could have imagined! We will definitely be back!

name: Charles Sasser
text: I give this place 5stars owners are awesome and very hard workers they tend to everything that needs to be tended to ASAP nice play area for the kids just a all around laid back awesome rv park most definitely will be back

resp.text: Thank you so much Charles, We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Y’all are wonderful and Thankful to have meet you all.

name: misty black
text: Went for two days and ended up staying a month. The owners Jason and Misty made me and my grandkids fell at home. My husband was able to fish without worrying about the kids around the water. We will be going back and I recommend this camp grounds

name: Jenny Sennamon
text: Its is a very nice and quiet place to stay at..i stayed there almost a month and i plan on coming back and staying aging after my sister has surgery ..bye then i will need some quiet time..so if u havent been there u should give it a chance ..you can camp...tent out....fish...swimm..really nice place to go to especially if u want some peace and quiet.

name: Shawn nofrey
text: Great place to stay! We have been here for the last few months while working in town and absolutely love it. It's quiet country living at its best. The owners Misty and Jason are very friendly and truly make you feel welcome.

resp.text: Thank you so much Shawn, I have enjoyed getting to meet all of you. You all have become family to me.

name: GypsyDanger_ 1125 (kyle)
text: Best camp ground I have ever stayed in all the people are very nice and very understandable. All around the best

resp.text: Thank you so much Kyle

name: Monica Petoskey
text: A great place to stay! We have been here for 2 months while working and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere. It's nice to be in the country. Good place to be when you have children... feels almost like home.  😉

resp.text: Thank you so much Monica, It has been a pleasure having your family at Mulberry Creek Camp. We hope you come back and visit us again soon 😊

name: Lukas Steiblys
text: A lovely park that accepts nightly and longer term stays. All new and tidy. The owner is also very friendly and likes talking about the park. Don't hesitate to call.

resp.text: Thank you so much and it was very nice meeting you. I hope you all have a wonderful Journey and enjoy site seeing.

name: Aaron Rudquist
text: The nicest ppl! quiet n secluded, there’s a little corgi that roams around there, his names JJ  if you see him  be good to him n give em a good belly scratch for me!

resp.text: Thanks Aaron, I think everyone loves Jack Jack

text: Very well kept campground and friendly. Enjoyed my stay.

resp.text: Thank you Sean, We hope if you are ever back in the area you visit us
