resp.text: Thank you Nancy

name: Phillip Ray
text: Very friendly and very nice

name: JASON MAZINGO
text: Great People !

name: Clark Sheppard
text: Tried calling this # but its no longer in service

name: Gerald Brown
text: Great primitive camping next to a beautiful creek for kyacking. On clear nights awesome view of the start sky... :-)

name: Richard Petyk
text: Beautiful campground with nice bathrooms. It's a primitive camping experience, don't expect dump stations and hook ups for RVs. Found one bar of Verizon 4G service. The beauty, solitude, and listening to the wildlife are well worth the price.

name: Eric Underwood
text: This is a favorite campground of mine.  It is setup for primative camping.  They have a very nice bath house.  They do have a spicket on the side of the building for water.  The campground is in a very large hidden valley between two mountain ridges.  It is right on the Chief Ladiga bike trail (mile marker 7) and also on the Pinhoti hiking trail.  There is a very nice creek running through the campground.  Some of the sites along the creek have picnic tables and a trash can.  I have stayed here with my wife in our travel trailer and also many times with our boy scout troop.  Be careful using Google Maps to get there.  There is a bridge out on 94 which is the road the campground is on.  You must go over the mountain and in from the east side.

name: Larry Johnson
text: Certainly a beautiful campground and can't be beat for direct access to the Chief Ladiga Trail. The problem is FINDING this place. There are virtually NO signs (other than a 8 x 12 inch sign right before the the entrance that you MIGHT see in the daylight.) They don't even give directions on their own website; just a link to a map, which is useless if you don't have a cell phone or don't get a signal when you get close.  I honestly could write specific directions to the site in less than a minute; they NEED TO DO THIS AND POST IT ON THEIR WEBSITE! We spent an hour trying to find the place after leaving the town of Piedmont. They should also work with the county to get some signs up; cause they do pay a substantial amount of tax money into this little county when they are busy.

name: Faline Aubuchon
text: Clean, quiet and  beautiful hideaway

name: Corey Johnson
text: This was one of the nicest campgrounds we have been to. Very beautiful and out in country and what makes it better hardly no cell service if u are like me and my wife we are fine with that. The brothers that run the place dude and terry they are the best very nice and very respectful they make u feel right at home. If u haven’t been here u for sure need to plan a trip. I will be back for sure with family.

name: Cheryl Chapman
text: First time we stayed there we were welcomed by two of the sweetest two brothers! They made feel like family! Love them! We rode bikes that they provided to bike on the trail. What s beautiful place to ride!  The campground is like a little place of heaven! We are planning another trip next weekend. We can't wait!

name: Art Of Valor
text: If you and your family/significant other or just you yourself are looking for a peaceful, beautiful and relaxing getaway then I highly recommend this campground! Grounds are well maintained and the scenery is breathtakingly beautiful. The sunrises and sunsets are amongst the best you'll find anywhere you go! Very secluded, yet just a very short distance from the city of Piedmont, Alabama. Can't wait to visit this place again!

name: Mike O'Quinn
text: Stayed overnight on a bike camping trip on the Silver Comet-Chief Ladiga trails. Very nice, shaded campsites next to a flowing stream, and super clean bathhouse with restrooms and showers. Felt very safe. Caretakers came through several times keeping an eye on things. With biking and hiking so accessible, it is a great place to camp out overnight.

name: John H Ratliff
text: Great place and convenient for trail riders. If you don't reserve your spot online beforehand be aware that they only take cash onsite.

name: Julian stirbing
text: Great experience for 2 ppl and 2 dogs. Only 1 other family there. We could let the dogs off leash when we were setting up since no one was around. Nice staff. Nice, clean bathroom with clean showers. All sites are primitive, no hook ups. Really enjoyed ourselves, but wished we had our bike to ride on the paved bike trail.

name: Byron Nelson
text: Remote but scenic and roomy, with a mountain on one side and a stream on the other. Very nice indoor toilets and showers centrally located. Pavilions with cover and set-in tables and chairs. Hiking, bicycling and picnicking are well supported.

name: Ditza Israeli
text: The spot is literally right on the bike trail. Bathrooms & showers are clean. The entire place is really well manicured and cared for. A beautiful, quiet place to spend a few nights. I do not believe they have actual hook ups, but you can park your RV there and use your generator.

name: Structure Music USA
text: Scenery is like a movie. All the surroundings are amazing very peaceful with the sounds of a small river running thru the grounds. Entry is on the trail.  Very clean facilities. Fire puts at every camp site.

name: Kimm Wright
text: We were just passing through, but the campground was clean and in a beautiful setting.

name: Kenny H
text: Stayed with a group of Boy Scouts biking on the CLT. Great campground that can accommodate 100 plus campers. Covered picnic area and clean restrooms and bathhouse. Highly recommend.

name: Ch S (Papachaz)
text: the website says there are hookups for your RV, there are no hookups. there are bathrooms, and they have a dump station and 2 water faucets for fresh water. All these 'local guides' giving reviews, LOL something is fishy about that too. ;)   The place is beautiful, a couple of stock ponds for fishing, at no charge, and camping right along the creek. There are no real designated sites, you set up where ever you want. There are several rock fire pits, and we were told 'if you need a picnic table, we'll hook to one and drag it over there for ya'. It is right next to the Chief Ladiga Trail, and has access to the Pinhoti Trail for hiking, but it gets 2 stars from me because $25 a night for primitive camping is a bit ridiculous

name: Faline Aubuchon
text: Clean, quiet and  beautiful hideaway

name: Ed Ralston
text: Fantastic park, very clean restrooms with hoyle, clean showers. Beautiful views

name: Steve Horne
text: Great place, beautiful and secluded- the bath house was very clean and neat.  Will stay again!

name: Mary McGowan
text: Beautiful campground with great amenities. Bring cash or check!

name: Daniel Tatum
text: Quiet, clean campground right off the Chief Ladiga trail. Direct access to bike path, showers, and friendly folks running the place.

name: Van Valvis
text: Right off the silver conet

name: Ferrell Moultrie
text: Nice campground

name: Scott Thaxton
text: Well maintained property

name: Tommy Smith
text: Great people and environment

name: John Yarbrough
text: Great place to camp and fish also a well stocked store

name: Steve Haney
text: Nice quiet place! Beautiful!

name: Cowboy Blue
text: Everyone was polight and helpful.very clean.and hospitable. You've got to go there the waterfall is breathtaking.and also have kiack rental there to.good fishing, awesome swimming and boat launches.

name: John White
text: Great getaway

name: Marvin Clay
text:
Stopped by bc friend broke down on jet ski that lived on opposite side of lake  they let me use their boat ramp for free
Little things like that add up friendly people will recomend them again

name: Pam Russell
text: We just got our spot today looking forward to meeting all you folks this spring🤣😂

name: Scott Simpkins
text: Visited a friend there...now looking for a spot to call mine! Great location to decompress and get away from the bright lights and big box stores!!!

name: Eugene Roos.
text: Really nice place, staff is super friendly, the facility is nice, good fishing, and all the campers/neighbors are super friendly.

name: Darrell Weaver
text: Great Place Great People.

name: Opal Wilder
text: Love the family place

name: Terry Hill
text: I love it ok

name: Kay Magin
text: Love this campground

name: Jeremy Locklear
text: Friendly

name: Daniel Duke
text: Nice quiet family Run Campground

name: CAMO 9513
text: Needs more stuff to do there

name: Kristine Bryant
text: This is a fantastic camp ground. The lots have full hook up for RV's and level ground for tents. We had a double lot with an RV and 2 tents and there was still plenty of room. The view of the lake is fantastic. There is a small beach area for swimming and miles of beach to fish from. The restroom and showers were exceptionally clean. It is very pet friendly. Overall it was a great experience.

name: Suzanne Paxton
text: Nice & quiet, wonderful hosts! We selected our site (unseen) online. When we arrived it was pouring rain and our site (the only one in the whole park that was steep) was too steep for our rig. Hosts called to check on us and switched site for us, even delivered new tags. Great star gazing, clean facilities, and fun fishing. Nice people & locals. I do recommend, and had decent Verizon service.

name: TJ Hill
text: Peaceful, serene location. Level sites with picnic tables, fire pits, and large gravel area. Some areas have fabulous water access especially Pirate's Cove. Lake View has a nice beach. Shady Loop is aptly named, no water views. Good laundry room with a folding table, and hooks for hanging. Only negative is there is only one washer and dryer.

name: Michael Patterson
text: Really nice place! Great fishing lots and so far we've had a blast. But the play ground being closed was a bummer. Kids need entertainment too!!!

name: Norma Bland
text: We were told that we could fish from our camp area because I use a wheel chair.  And that we could park a boat there.  That is not the case.  We were not allowed to drive through to find a good spot  for me and wheel chair. We are not happy campers at this time. We feel we have been lied to.  Donald Bland

name: Stephanie Trapp
text: Loved our stay can't wait to go back everything was very clean

name: Ronnie Rigsby
text: Hardridge is a great Campground we have stayed here many times  the bathroom are AC and heated the park is clean  love it just wish the Rec.Gov was gone,I dont like having to make revolution  3 months  out ,but the park is GREAT

name: Samuel Harrison
text: Awesome campground and amazing fishing and very nice kept campground just watch out for snake and alligators

name: Rod Peavey
text: First time camping here. Campground attendant's where very nice and helpful. Clean bathrooms and showers. Grass was very well maintained and beautiful. Or veiw from campsite was very beautiful .

name: ShayBabé Lyfe
text: I must say I've lived in Eufaula, Clayton and Bakerhill Alabama off and on my whole life and I've never been to this park. It is so beautiful and peaceful.  The nice lady at the gate was helpful. I will appreciate them for helping my family through a great get together. I look forward to returning when we come back from Florida.

name: Nathan Reynolds
text: If I could give this place zero stars then I would. Campground has very little sites on the water. Most sites are just in the woods. The lady up front was very rude. We brought 2 trucks for camper, boat, I brought my car so I could drive back and forth to work, and had my brother and his family coming the next day. So total of 4 vehicles(can only have 3 per campsite). The lady had an idea that to be able for all 4 vehicles to come in we pay for an extra lot. We asked if we paid for that lot could we put just the boat and a vehicle there(we only have 1 camper and no tent) she said that was fine. We pay for the lot and she starts having a fit that we are just putting the boat and a car on the lot(even though she just said it was fine) but then says it's fine though and allows us to continue anyway. The next morning my brother shows up and she mentions the lot with the boat and car and calls the park ranger to tell us to remove it. So we say that's fine and we remove my car from our original site and park it out of the park. She then yells at us we only have 30 mins to remove the boat and car from the extra site or she would have us kicked out after it was her idea and we paid for it. I will never be coming back here. If you need me I'll be at other campgrounds.

name: obie wan
text: Amazing place, you'll really appreciate how well that's been taken care of great fishing reel nice people awesome camping spots very clean

name: Travis Reynolds
text: It's a nice place if you can get a good lot on the water! Their is not a bunch of lots on the water like some of the other campgrounds though! I know people have a job to do but the people at the front gate was a little rude in my opinion. You can get your point across and stick to the rules with a little better customer service after all we pay to come here! Like I said I know their's rules but all you have to do is talk to someone with some kindness! Not sure if we'll come back.

name: Gary Canning
text: Fantastic RV park spacious sites clean restrooms & great lake view. Recommend site 45

name: Thomas Parish
text: The view was nice, the park rangers are nice. The lady at the gate is nice but the man riding around patrolling whether someone parked on grass was not nice. At all. The grass there hasn't been cut in a long time. It was really high with ants everywhere. They should worry more about keeping the grass cut than whether the spot you temporarily parked your car is going to make a potential camper think the lot next to it isn't available.

name: Calabe Davis
text: Nice park if you can get a water spot. Really great during the week.

name: Jessica Campbell
text: One of our favorite places to camp! We love everything about it! Bring ant spray😉🙂

name: Marty L Miles
text: Wonderful place to relax and fish

name: John Martin
text: Not open year round, but one of the nicest, most beautiful campgrounds  I've experienced.

name: Debbie Williamson
text: Wonderful place to get away and it is quite and peaceful

name: Geoff Whitworth
text: Great lake access, clean restrooms, friendly staff. But the ANTS are insane. We woke up to full infestation. Bring raid, bring ant repellant, clean up your food. Do not underestimate the ants!

name: Elle R
text: The only reason I didn't give this park 5 stars is that I only found it today and haven't actually stayed at the campground YET.  The campground host Butch Wilson was very helpful.  He answered all of our questions and made us feel very welcome at the park.  This campground has everything you want in  order to park and enjoy water sports, and fishing (bring your own boat and watercraft)or just some quiet R and R. There are some waterside lots with beautiful views and if not on the water most of the lots provide great shade.  The park was very well kept.  Grass was mowed.  Sites looked to have been raked or blown clear of debris. They have pull thru sites as well as back in sites. Some of the sites have sewer connections.  Best recommendation I can give is I am really looking forward to booking our site for our next trip to this area.

name: Loren Rodgers
text: Hardridge Creek is very nice and well maintained.  I gave it 4 stars because the swim area was filled with geese poop, which I understand is not their fault, but is a turn off for families with kids. Some of the first campsites are hard to get to by boat, and website should be more specific as to the difficulty.  It was very clean, including fish cleaning station and bathrooms. The "gatekeepers" were very nice.

name: Aimie S Whiddon
text: If you like a layed back atmosphere and good fishing. You will love it here!

name: De Mo
text: Excellent family getaway

name: Thomas Ivines
text: Beautiful park but laden with trash. Cigarette butts everywhere.  Plastic bottles, sterifoam and other garbage washed up on the shoreline.  The black ants about took over our camper.

name: Joshua Moody
text: Spot is beautiful but the people that work here suck.

name: William Burl Key
text: We travel frequently and when we go to the Eufaula area we always stayed at White Oak Creek but the “Inn” was full!  SURPRISE!!!! Found Hardridge to be very clean and the front and camp staff very nice and accommodating.   Great layout, full hookup, good fishing.  Wish Shady loop had access to closer fishing options but we will definitely be back.

name: Jamie Sheard
text: The campground location is fabulous, but the staff are the rudest we have ever encountered at a campground. We camp frequently and with large groups and have never been treated the way we were here. We will definitely NOT be returning.

name: Karen Machuca
text: The campground itself is nice. The people who work in the front are VERY RUDE! The park ranger is also rude. They gave us a “ticket” for parking the car on the grass by the campsite.. They wanted all the cars who weren’t on  concrete to park across from the bathrooms.. which was a major  inconvenience.. then on the last day, we parked the car and boat in an empty campsite across from ours. Since everyone had already left and got ticketed for that as well. Not too mention the bathrooms were dirty. And the campsites need maintenance. Will not be coming here again.

name: jim dial
text: Great coe campground on the lake.

name: Randy Messer
text: Ran buy Corp of Engineers. Super quiet most sights are shaded over 70 sights . There are some with sewer hook ups. The host are very friendly. Call before a holiday to get the best spots.

name: Julie Thuener
text: We always love to have relaxing days on the lake and walk with nature. Always meet wonderful people there each time.

name: Chuck Andres
text: Don't keep there parks to clean. Common for corps of engineers

name: William Clepper
text: Clean and shady. Good fishing. Relaxing.

name: Diane Siniard
text: Nice and clean area. Need places to tie up boats so you can enjoy picnic area while boating for the day.

name: Donnie Chesser
text: Very disappointed with personality of people that run signing up campers Very rude Will not be going back as long as these people are running the Park !!!

name: Chris Richards
text: Went camping for the weekend had great time very quiet and peaceful with nature

name: Cee Cee Broughton
text: Looks like a cool lake. Nice ride from ft Rucker

name: Pam Smith
text: Relaxing stay..can't wait to do it again.

name: Michael Ford
text: Great RV camping, lake views, beach and boat access. Some sites are full hook up.

name: Luis Contreras

text: Love the park!

name: Charles Wolfe

name: Russell Hunter
text: Good place

text: Loved the peace and  the outdoors.

name: Zachary Barnes
text: Pretty place

name: Amanda Anglin
text: Ants are ridiculous at this place , the most ants I have ever seen at a campground

name: Jennifer Riffee
text: Best family campground

name: Steve C.
text: Peace and quiet

name: Larry Reeves
text: Great place to camp

name: Darlene Perez
text: Love this place

name: Terri Reeves
text: Very peaceful . clean restrooms and bathhouse. Had a great stay, will go back. Ants were kinda bad but just take some spray and all is fine.

name: Debra Mays
text: Time Away RV Resort is awesome. Currently still under construction with a complete hospitable atmosphere.  Anticipating the continuing construction of all the phases.  This place is a great asset to the community at large and should foster other economic growth in Talladega County.  Much more  success!!

resp.text: Thank you for all that you do! We appreciate you! Time Away RV Resort!

name: Queen's Escapades
text:
This RV park is close to the race track. The owners are very friendly and make great host. The park has gravel sites at this time,  a playground and dog walk.   They had a BBQ booth the weekend of the April race and the food was really good. The pool is under construction and will be a big plus once complete!  We look forward to seeing their continued progress.  Reason for 4 stars... Although all the sites are pull through, they are not at an angle,  making for a very sharp turn to get into sites which can be difficult for some Big Rigs like ours, and the sites are very close to each other.  We spent most of our time at the race so these items were not an issue for us.  We will definitely stay here again.

The Queen's Carriage  - Jr & Sharron

resp.text: Thanks so much!

name: Ty Hill
text: Nate and Alicia have done a great job with this premium RV park. We had a great time camping last weekend and really enjoyed the entertainment and all of the people we met. The pull through camp sites make it easy and convenient to setup quickly.

resp.text: Thank you! We can't wait to finish Phase 1! Time Away RV Resort!

name: Janelle Sprowls
text: We stayed for their very first weekend during their grand opening. I had followed their story since the place was a field and was excited to see the progress, was not disappointed, it is a very nice place. The owners will go out of their way to make you feel welcome and your stay pleasant. We are founding members and will be back!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Bruce Williams
text: This place is really coming along. They're working hard for the grand opening. Alicia and her husband gets an A++++. You have to make this one of your stops even if it's a little out the way.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Don Williams
text:
Enjoyed our visit.  The owners were super friendly and very helpful.  They are still making improvements to the property.   It promises to be a very nice campground. It is close to the racetrack and has full hookup.  I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in the area.

Don and Bonnie,  Grenada, MS

resp.text: Thank you!

name: J.C. Foster
text: Up and coming RV park. Great host looking forward to our next trip there.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Melissa Robbins
text: Highly recommend! Full hookups (water pressure is great)! The campground owners were very helpful and gracious. This will be a great get away once they complete the campground. Cannot wait to see it later this yr.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Scott Carpenter
text: Had a wonderful time even with a full day of rain. Will definitely be going back and the 12 hour drive won't stop me

resp.text: Hi Scott! Thanks so much for visiting! We are looking forward to your next visit! Thanks, Time Away RV Resort

name: Andrew Haney
text: Nate and Alicia Lawson have created a little slice of heaven at Time Away. It has been a true blessing to be involved with these wonderful down to earth people. Growing up in the area I know firsthand that Talladega and the surrounding communities have longed for such a place. I'm so excited to see what the future has in store for us all. Keep on keepin on!

resp.text: We are so excited to meet you and your work has been Awesome! Thanks!

name: Laron Perry
text: It was very clean spacious also having  basketball court and other activities for everyone age group and the staff was simply Great and kind I would definitely recommend this Rv resort

resp.text: Thanks Laron!

name: Charles Oldham
text: Ok people it's growing near. What am I talking about? The Grand Opening of Time Away RV Resort in Lincoln, Alabama. This is an event that you don't wanna miss. It's going to be epic. The owners have done a great job of creating something very special. To think that the owners actually gave us RV camping folks a chance to give our input in the making of something so great , is absolutely amazing and shows how much they want their Resort to be one of a kind. If you miss this Grand opening, you will truely miss something spectacular! Thanks to the owners Nathan and Alicia Lawson for all of their hard work , creating a place that we all can take pride in and enjoy.  Thank you much.

resp.text: This should make everyone excited to join us! We am looking forward to meeting you and your family! Thank you so much!

name: Pam Johnston
text: Owners was very friendly.  To be a new full hookup Rv Campground close to the Race Track  is wonderful cant wait to stay again. If you get a chance go check them out.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Marlon Moss
text:
I have to say that it was awesome finally meeting the owners during our stay.  Really proud of them and to see the great work and progress with the continued construction.
The location of the resort was excellent - not far from the Interstate, and a relatively short drive to stores (i.e. Walmart, etc.).
Have been to quite a few RV resorts and honestly some good takeaways and some not so good experiences.  My ONLY criticism was it seemed the sites were a little close to each other, however, the owners made accommodations and created some good spacing for those of us that were reserved in some of the smaller sites.  I also believe that I overheard that the owners were looking to make some improvements as they continue to complete the overall construction.
But again, really inspiring to see this all come together in the way that it is and I will DEFINITELY be back in June for the Grand Opening.
#GreatTimes #GreatOwners #GreatStory2Tell #LastingFriendships #Inspiring #TimeAway

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Mr. E
text: I visited this place and I can not wait to go back. Quiet and no BS there.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: John Cotton
text:
Very new and a work in progress by a couple pouring their heart and sweat in building this RV Resort.
It is a great location to the Talladega Motor Raceway.

resp.text: Thank you John! It’s been a pleasure having you here and we are looking forward to seeing you again! Thanks

name: Jake Wells
text: Super nice owners! Made our stay very pleasant!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Scott Nemecheck
text: Great new resort! Well done.

resp.text: Thank you!

Additionally, the campground is conveniently close to the Browns Ferry Nuclear Plant (for us contract personnel)-  it is exactly 12 miles driving distance.

name: IMSTEPF films
text:
OK let me preface this review with the fact that in the last 11 days we have been to approximately 10 RV Parks from Northern California; Oregon; Idaho; Wyoming; NM; CO; OK; TX; TN; AK; and North AL.
The  pool is fresh and alive with the sound of kids ; easy pull in; friendly propieters; needs a good deal of TLC starting with repaving the whole park; definitely no perks of frills; if you wanna get your gritty trailer park culture on -this is it-spotty internet; no clubhouse; or showers or bathrooms; no doggy area; there is random grassy area to rear side of property lines for doggies to sniff; several near demolished or abandoned manufactured homes; mostly trailers and 5th wheels at front of property; lots of military personnel; we r here to see family for two weeks; definitely not a “good sam” status but at least we got 50amps electric; sewer ,water and a place to park the 67’ of luggage in tow; its a cultural experience and for that we are grateful; as well as having time w family; kids and my brother deploying soon— bless Enterprise RV for providing safe basecamp and shelter a mile from our  family and their cozy abode.

name: Karen Lehman
text:
We have stayed here a few times now while visiting my mom who lives just 10 minutes away. Very friendly community, hookups work and the sites are clean and maintained as far as keeping up with the mowing and weeds.  My husbands only complaint is some of the sites are not easy to get all the level, so improvements to the spots would be super beneficial.
In the summer the pool is open. It’s clean, a nice suave and the long term community uses it and seem to behave and respectful of noise and closing time for travelers.   The staff is so nice, friendly and accommodating. They are super helpful getting up into your site and making sure you are allowed set.
NOTE: They only take cash, check or PayPal, no credit cards so be prepared for that.

name: Michael White
text: Missing street name signs, poorly paved streets, and poorly organized housing sections made finding a residence a real challenge. Wrong Google Maps location took me to the incorrect place and forced me to meet the resident at the entrance to guide me back to the right place.

If your RVing and want to stay in the enterprise area you won’t go wrong by parking it here.

text: My grandparents and I have stayed here two time. Mr. Joe and Mrs. Angie are very kind! Very quiet place. If you plan on coming to this area, stay here. You wont regret it!

name: Carolyn Holt
text: Bates Creek Rv Park is a wonderful place to stay if you are in the area. It has several rv spots which include wifi. This quaint spot is in the country but close enough to stores that it wont take you 5 min to get to town. This rv park also has cabins for rent for very affordable prices. Cabins include wifi and satelight tv. They can include 1 or 2 beds. The 1 bed cabins include a couch and coffee table. The standard micro wave and dorm fridge are also included. There is enough space to really make it a roomy place. Each cabin also has added boot brush to help clean your boots from a hard days work. I love this place and will stay here every time we are this way. Mr Joe, the manager, is friendly and ensures everyone is safe and made welcome here. Ms Angie is one of the sweetest people ive ever had the pleasure of meeting. She will make sure your stay is pleasant and comfortable. For me, this is my new home away from home.

name: Heather Church
text: Great place! My husband, 3 yr old son and i stayed here a year ago and are back again now. Here for about a month each time and as of right now still have had no problems. People running the place are great, very friendly and helpful, genuinely just good people. The cabins are affordable, clean, well taken care of, there is a trailer set up with 2 washers & dryers so laundry is easy... The only drawback id say is that there's no bathtub, only a shower. Not an issue for me but makes life just a little bit more difficult with my toddler.

name: doug mckinney
text:
After 4 months of managing the Bates Creek RV park we have added 15 cabins and RVs for rental along with the RV lots. Several lots are drive thru for our overnight and weekend guest and they all have the 20,30 and 50 amp electrical plugins. Water and ez connect waste. TV WIFI. Being located on highway 43 makes us ez to find and our 2 entrances for North or South travel makes your everyday travel more pleasurable. You can see us Facebook or overhead satellite views on goggle, my Red cabin also is being featured at the lucky duck RV park site and we welcome our friends and guest from our time managing the former Bates Lake park as well. We have good clean shady lots and our oceanless beach front property for parties,sunbathing and just walking around the 63 acres or by the creek.
Thanks and come on down.

name: A Z
text: The 2 tent only sites are the nicest sites on the campground.  All sites, including the tent only sites, have water and electricity.

name: Gail Speer
text:
This Army Corp Campground has 30 camp sites, 11 are pull through on the river side, 3 back ins on the river side, 2 tent sites at the back of loop, and 14 back in sites across from the river and into the woods. All sites are large and level with concrete and asphalt pads, gravel areas with concrete picnic tables, stationary fire rings and grills, and pole hangers for your garbage or lights and some have wooden fish cleaning tables.  All sites have water and 110, 30
And 50 amp service. There is no sewer at any site but there is a well cared for dump station. The bathhouse is kept clean but is slightly outdated with plumbing fixtures and sinks that could be replaced but are functioning. There is a playground area near the bath house.
There is a day use area that has a boat ramp, fishing area, picnic tables, grills, garbage containers,  large modern playground and bathrooms.
There are 4-1/2 miles of hiking trails which are in the process of being cleared after the last hurricane.
The campground is safe as the gates gets locked at 10pm and don’t open until 6am so no drive through traffic during the night.

name: Adam Campbell
text: Great campground and hosts! The tugboats and barges going by the campsites really added to the experience.

name: louis wengler
text: Staff very friendly and helpful.

name: Sandi Vines
text: Large drive thru campsites on the water. We enjoyed watching the barges go by with tugboats at our campsite! Very quiet & peaceful. Great camp hosts. We'll definitely be back!

name: Tristy Eckhoff
text: This park is very nice, with sites right on the river. It is so relaxing watching the push boats going up and down the river. The bath house was very well maintained and the handicapped shower has a bench seat. There is good Hot water and ample water pressure. The sites along the river are my preference but the other are very nice also. The Hosts are very nice and helpful when needed. We have AT&T cell service and we did not get good reception. I had seen in several reviews where people had gotten good service. Ours was spotty at best. Overall it was an enjoyable stay.

name: Michel Laferriere
text:
Nice campground.
Pros:
- A river runs right next to campsites. Every now and then we can watch a large barge slowly going by.
- Sites are well spread and private.
- Very level
- Camp hosts keep it very clean
- Bring your fishing poles!
Cons:
- Park management doesn't keep grass cut not even in the camp sites. There are lots of bees who like the tall weeds. My wife and I got bee stung multiple times just walking around the RV. That wouldn't happen is grounds were kept.
- There is nothing to do around the area. Worse because of COVID im sure.
- Can't catch any TV channels

name: B Morgan
text: My favorite campground. Doesn't have sewage hookups, but has handicap spot available as both my children are wheelchair bound. Very convenient.

name: Robert Newton 5517
text: WoW, this place is awesome! The mosquitoes are bad late in evening, but we had deep woods off, a must have in the summer/fall season. UPDATE, we just spent a week here, the park is awesome,  but we have 2 beagle dogs. The guy beside us complained about them, even though they barley barked, come on, they are dogs. He was reading his  book . We even put them up after that, my wife said he kept giving them a mean look when they were fishing. The volunteers are constantly riding around looking for something. If you are like us, in our 40's, stay up late, everyone is usually going bed 7:00. This is a older person's place to read and be very quiet. We wont be going back for that reason. Even one of the volunteers said, it's a wonder you haven't gotten any complaints on those dogs, that's whole reason to camp, to take your babies. We will go where we feel more welcome.

name: David Henry
text: We decided to escape the threat of Hurricane Irma by taking our RV to camp here. The whole family loved it. The staff at the park were absolutely fabulous, made us feel safe and welcome during a very difficult time. Many thanks to Ms. Sheila and Mr. Richard for looking out for us!

name: Cricket Kosko
text: Great Bre da and Donald are great hosts

text: It's a very nice campground. The hosts were friendly and helpful. The park was clean and well manicured. We enjoyed the stay.

name: Mallory Stroop
text: We stayed on the 2 tent only sites and I must say amazing! The walk to the restrooms was long but the quite and closeness to true nature was worth it! The view of the river was breathtaking! It would have been better if we had a boat but if your idea of camping is relaxing by the fire and taking in nature just relaxing this is the campground for you!

Peaceful place, very nice camping facilities and friendly hosts, man what a stay!!! Came back again and it only got better. Blue bbq opened in silas.Best bbq I've had in a very long time.

name: Wayne
text:
I stayed at one of the two tent sites. In my opinion,  I had the best spot in the park. ;-) The river was right below my site with hundreds of elephant ears along the bank. Tombigbee was gently flowing downstream, as if to say, "Take a load off, relax." The sun set in the trees, casting its final rays of the day on the waters.

The moon didn't come out till later that night. So with the lights of a city miles away, I had the opportunity to see the most stars (and many actually "twinkling") that I've seen in twenty years.

The only downside, and one for which I should have prepared, was the mosquitos near the tent areas. Next time I'm bringing repellant.

name: Catherine Davidson

text: Beautiful place

name: Tanya MrsTtotheW
text: Beautiful area. We stayed in our motor home last week of June 2020, had a good time.  We were at yellow hammer loop,  site 16.  This site is on a lake side but during the summer it overgrown with bushes so you don't have a view,  only when leaves fall down.  Also fireplace is not on a flat surface,  so we had accident falling or tripping on a grill during night time.  Site 15 has view of a lake even during the summer because it is elevated.  Site 18 also on a lake side but no view during the summer. Hosts were nice, cleaned vacated lots promptly.  Yellowhammer loop has boat ramp and overlook on a lake. Sites 19 and 17 pull through.  Also plenty of electric/water sites and tent as well.  We drove to sipsey wilderness , directions in  there are very confusing, found a few waterfalls but couldn't find a big one . Also we biked to a lake/beach area and in both loops.  Overall we liked it and would recommend to others.

name: John Edington
text: We had a great weekend camping.  The only downside was that we did not get our entrance until late the first evening.  Fortunately there was another camper who helped us.

name: The Nealons
text: Beautiful campground. The hosts were spectacular. Campsite was perfect. We will return.

name: Aaron Cummins
text: Entire facility is well kept and maintained.  We frequently use the boat ramp here.  There is ample parking and the launch ramp is great.  You do have to pay to use this ramp, but I feel it is worth it.  You can pay the daily rate of $6.00 or get a season pass for $45.00.  That pass will give you use of all the "day" facilities.

name: Tammy Smothers
text: Well kept camp ground friendly helpful host.  Bathhouse is always clean.  Most camp sites have good shade and full hookups. Nice tent loop. Nice day use area and boat launch. Good fishing also. Small town nearby if supplies or groceries are needed.  Depending on what site you're on in Yellowhammer loop there is little or no cell service or antenna TV. Frirefly loop has decent cell service and TV. We seen a lot of wildlife our last stay here.  We love this campground and Clear Creek that is near-by for a quick get away that's near home.

name: Brandon Word
text: The actual campground is great. The spaces are nice and accommodating. The camp host is why they get a1 star review. He has a big head and thinks he owns the place. He also likes to harass people needlessly. I will never go back!!

name: Keith Coleman
text: Very nice camp area. Bath houses are top notch, the best we have seen in Alabama. Plenty of space between campsites.

name: Pat Dale
text:
We have camped at Corinth several times. The sites are so nice! The bathhouses are clean and well kept.
The campground is on the lake and there is a boat ramp close by. It's a quiet place and we really like it.

name: Ashley Foster
text: Cheap fun! We paid $6 to park and swam all day. The beach has small rocks instead of all the sand. Much better than being covered in sand in my opinion. This place has the cleanest bathrooms I've ever seen in a rec area. There are also picnic tables all around. Highly recommend this place.

name: Richard Cooper
text: Super clean everyone was helpful and nice! Gotta follow and be aware of covid 19 rules.

name: Linda Shipman
text: It was a very clean campground.. bathrooms and grounds.  We had no ideal the park had filled up as we camped.. it was very quite and peaceful. There was a nice rocked overlook with benches too. I'd camped there before in the primitive sites and enjoyed it also but it could use a little improvement in that area because some of the sites had rutted drives otherwise it was great all around.

name: Chad Smith
text: Great place to meet. Out of the way, discreet but public fun!!! Excellent place for affairs

name: Steve Smith
text: The hosts John and Becky are great! Been to alot of campgrounds, they make you feel at home here. Very accomadating and friendly! Super clean and very family friendly. No cruising golf carts and partying kids to worry about. Price is very affordable, if peace and quite is your thing, here it is. Heaven on earth.

name: janice tabios
text: Clean and peaceful

name: Scott Wells
text: Nice campground and lake , very clean restrooms

name: Pam Kidd
text: Let me start off by stating that I don't frequent recreation areas for camping because I prefer to go backpacking and back woods camping. That being said, this is one of the most pleasurable camping trips that I have ever been on. Chris and his coworker (I didn't catch his name) are wonderful campground hosts. They were very friendly, helpful and maintained the campground rules in a way that made us feel like they were looking out for us instead of restricting us. The bathhouses are immaculate. The campsites are kept clean. There are multiple things to see and do if you want to adventure into the forest and it's a great place to just chill and do nothing. I will definitely go back.

name: Brittany Henderson
text: The host staff was very helpful and our expierence was great. Will go back. And I would recommend. We had so much fun. There are lots of places to put kayaks in the water and the campsites were extremely comfortable. Next time I will stay longer than one night.

name: Brent McMurray
text: Excellent campground, friendly hosts. One of the cleanest water entries on Smith lake

text: The new hostess was rude to my husband, just because she could be, let us pay for camping, and then told us we would have to leave the nxt week! If you like nothingness this is your place , a car might come by every 6 hrs. Scary place!

name: George Frank
text: Very nice place !!! Campsites way too close together for my liking but everything else is top rate !! They have the cleanest bathrooms I've ever seen at a campground !!!!

Said they were at full capacity and they wouldn’t even let us look at the sites. I guess when they are full capacity they don’t worry about other potential campers. Won’t ever come here and camp.

name: Steve Rodney
text:
The owners of this RV Park were gracious to let me stay here for Hurricane Dorian.
I was a refugee from Savannah and didn’t want to leave my camper there not knowing where Dorian would hit in Georgia.
I called and they graciously let me stay during the hurricane free of charge!
I can’t say thank you enough.
These are good people and I was blessed by them.
The park is great, clean, and quiet.
I highly recommend it.

resp.text: Thank you very much for the kind words! We are glad we could help you during your time of need. Let us know if we can do anything for you and your family in the future!

name: Shane Coleman
text: I think the maintenance guy needs to mind his own business and do his job instead of harassing paying customers

resp.text:
Hello Shane,

We take pride in our park and make sure not to harass any customers during their time here. We do not allow any primitive camping in our park and do not allow tents. Our employees make sure all rules are followed for the well-being,quietness and cleanliness of our park. You arrived with your boss with the spring fling fair and pitched a tent in the back of our park without permission and had several complaints. We politely asked that you remove the tent you had pitched behind our storage building.

If you would like to give us any further feedback of your stay, please give our office a call at (334)-298-7503.

Thanks,
Sawyer's Mobile Home Estates & RV Park

name: Marylou King
text: I was quite disappointed in the place, considering the reviews.  But I think most of the reviews are based on the mobile home park rather than the RV park.  It’s a mobile home park, which I was aware of, with a few spaces for RV’s.  What was most dissatisfying, considering it was $35.00 a night, was that there was no bathhouse or laundry and no WiFi or cable, because the cable was broken at our site.  The site was level and we had no problem in length for our 30 ft. motorhome, car dolly, and car.  We only stayed for one night, so it was doable, but I won’t want to stay longer.

resp.text:
Thank you for your constructive feedback of our park. We are sorry that you did not have a excellent experience with our park. We do have over 60 RV sites and unfortunately cable does mess up sometimes, but we would be happy to accommodate for that trouble.  We are constantly looking for ways to improve upon our guest experience and welcome to any suggestions.  Do not hesitate to contact us at your earliest convenience if you would like to discuss this in further detail.

Thanks again for choosing Sawyer's Mobile Home Estates & RV Park

text: Home cooked meals, country accommodations, Christian atmosphere  and beautiful scenery and nature . Great photo opportunities for birders 👍

text: This place is just this side of heaven and  Pastor Josh is the caretaker

name: Sarah Cockrell
text: Beautiful peaceful place!! Very kind staff!!!

name: Coray S
text: Camp Chula Vista is amazing! The directors and counselors are full of God's spirit and love. The camp really works hard to pour that spirit and love into everyone. The daily structure of activities and games gives everyone something to look forward to. Friendships grow stronger, as kids work together through the week. That same friendship lasts through the year, as kids look forward to seeing each other again. You can't find a better place to be with God, than at this church camp.

name: Wesley Higgins
text: Such a beautiful place to disconnect from the world and recharge. The new beds sleep great at their hotel. They have so much to offer here. Canoeing, hiking, biking, sometimes even horses. A beautiful lake

resp.text: Thanks for your 5 star review. We hope you return soon.

name: Mel Bass
text: Camp Chula Vista has offered amazing experiences for my children for many years while they have grown up attending the summer camps.  My oldest daughter had her wedding rehearsal in the CRC and we used the hotel rooms for our guests.  The staff is amazing and I couldn't say enough good things about this camp. It was very clean and orderly.  The rehearsal meal was catered by Camp Chula Vista and was simply delicious.  My children always come home talking about the wonderful food that is served at the summer camps.  God is always the focus at Camp Chula Vista and continues to bless it.

resp.text: Thanks for your review.  We are glad your family continues to come enjoy God's beautiful view at Camp Chula Vista.

name: Karen Trippe
text: This place is a sanctuary, our group rents here 4 times a year and the Holy Spirit always shows up. The facilities are not new however the hospitality is fresh everytime!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the great rating. We are so glad that your group chooses Camp Chula Vista for your sanctuary.

(Translated by Google) It is a place to hoard and enjoy nature

(Original)
Se lugar para acaparar y disfrutar de la naturaleza

name: t lynn
text: Jeff and the staff at Spring Villa are friendly and hospitable.  I’ve been going to Spring Villa since I was a kid and remember swimming in the cold spring fed pool.  The pool has sadly closed but the nature trails are beautiful.  Now, as an adult, we visit and use the RV campgrounds when in town visiting family.  It is quiet and peaceful.  We love it.

name: Lea Anne Iles
text: Very reasonably priced, clean campground run by city of Opelika, AL. If coming in from east, don’t follow Google directions - you’ll be routed to a dirt road. Instead, take 51 south from i85, then left onto 169.

name: Jens Lutz
text: What a great campground.  There are only two in area and we chose this one and glad we did after we got a look at the competition the day after checking in.  We don't have WIFI but what we do have more than makes up.  Extremely clean and comfortable bathhouse, extremely quiet wooded setting and extremely friendly staff (Jeff is great).  Oh yes, forgot the best.  Level concrete pads!

name: Lawson Conoly
text: This is a small campground but great park. It is we'll maintained and is very peaceful. We stopped just for the night while traveling but walked some trails and found a geocache before leaving the next morning. Would definitely come back if I'm ever coming near Auburn or Opelika again. The guy running the place was very nice and helpful.

name: James Hayes
text:
Thought that I'd left a review a couple days ago but can't find it on here now.
I stayed here last week and it was a spur of the moment stop.  Jeff (the caretaker) was extremely accommodating and takes such good care of this site.  It's clean as a whistle and quiet.  Perfect clean, safe spot for a family or retired folks.  Not sure what Jeff makes but the man needs a raise!!  He was such a nice guy and obviously busts his tail keeping that place nice.  Great job Jeff!  Keep up the good work!  If I'm ever that way again I will stay for sure!

name: Kelley Manning
text: Very nice and quiet and convenient for an overnight stop and close to interstate.

name: Tonya Sartor
text: Enjoying my time here as my husband is working. May have one more month here. Nice place to stay. No cable. You do have water and electric

name: KAREN NORRIS
text: I grew up going here. Even though it has changed alot it is still nice and its fun to explore.

name: Barbara Jones
text: What a hidden jewel this campground,  just beautiful and the history of the place is like icing on a cake.  The sites are large and level, very clean, plenty of trash cans this is a city  owned property and the manager Jeff is the best, his knowledge of the area and the property was the highlight of our stay. We had a wonderful time and hope to be back.

name: Sharon Strickland
text: I cannot say enough good things about our host Jeff. His kindness and helpfulness are unsurpassed. The park itself was nicely kept, quiet and clean.

name: Carrie Mayes
text: I lived there as a child. I loved it and have so many wonderful memories. And the house is definitely haunted. The pool was the best. I swam everyday.

name: Shannon Manley
text: Great place to camp out. Have enjoyed the place since I was a child. Just wish the pool was still open. And trust me the house IS haunted.

name: Paul Martinez
text: Interesting place, nice little bit of history in an out of the way location

name: Michelle Aurit
text: My husband and I had our wedding at the Lodge 06/04/2016. It was awesome! The campground/park & lodge is very well maintained. Jeff is a great manager. He takes care of both places as if it were his own. The prices can't be beat. Other places of this beauty are 10x's the cost of Springvilla. I will highly recommend to everyone I know!

name: Chirleen Evans
text: A beautiful area, the trees are gorgeous! The young man who is currently serving as camp host was very pleasant and accommodating. However, upon our arrival, it wasn't very clear how to actually check-in. It was mid-afternoon on a Friday and the onsite General Store was closed. There was a sign on the door with a phone number so I called that and we were told to find a site and the camp host would arrive shortly. We stayed in the tent camping section for 3 nights, total cost was $66. Unfortunately the nearest outhouse was quite a walk from our site and we were only about halfway back into the camping area. I've been camping for 34 years and I don't think I have ever had to walk that far to use a bathroom. We had to drive to the bathhouse for showers because it's even farther than the outhouses and it's partway down a 25 mph road without sidewalks. While the bathhouse was pretty clean, the mini trash cans were not emptied the entire time we were there and with only one shower in each of the men/women's bathrooms, we often had to wait in lines with 2 or 3 people ahead of us. There's a great boat launch which was being utilized for a fishing tournament qualifying event the weekend we stayed so there was a ton of trucks/trailers coming and going and when we left in our car for a trip to town, we were blocked into the tent area by trucks lined up to pull their boats out of the water. There are signs posted not to block the road, and I realize how difficult it would be to enforce it, but I would recommend anyone planning to stay to check if similar events might be held and avoid the park at those times. Also, for some strange reason the tent area road was blocked off in several places by rope so we had to kind of forge our own way in some places which concerned me since I don't have a 4-wheel drive vehicle.  I think overall it's a really great campground, we felt isolated from other campers and our site was beautifully situated in the shade on a bluff above Tensaw River. The bugs were kind of bad but that was expected, we were prepared with bug spray. We also kept a smoky fire burning which helped.  I would love to see an outhouse placed in the middle of the tent area since the closest one was at the boat launch. I also recommend adding a map of the grounds to your website. We'd stay here again if there was an outhouse added to the tent area; otherwise, we probably won't come back which sucks because it's really beautiful. We really did enjoy ourselves, though.

resp.text: Thank you !
